name: ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Safe Work Method Statement complies with WorkCover regulations and NSW Govt OHS&R guidelines.
○ Work Health & Safety Act 2011 & Safety Regulation 2017
○ Submitted at least 14 days prior to affected work commencing.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Provide a floor covering plan / Shop drawing plan layout is approved by Client/Builder prior to install.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Give three days notice for background prior to laying carpet
○ Give three days notice for smooth edge and underlay ready for carpet
○ Give three days notice for each batch of carpet upon delivery to site
○ Give three days notice for completion of carpet prior to placing protection
○ Ardit areas which are low. Ensure areas are correctly fanned out to minimise noticeable ramp in levels adjusted.
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Ensure that underlay is even, level, joints are flush and fixed according to manufacturer’s details
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Set out carpet to minimise joints
○ Ensure that carpet in a single area comes from one manufacturing batch and dye lot
○ Aluminium reducing strips to exposed edges
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - High traffic areas free of joins
○ Drill plug and screw edge strips
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Floor Protection installed prior to opening access to other trades
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Non-conformances all closed out
○ Submit 3 copies of maintenance manuals, including care and maintenance.
○ Submit 1% of carpet used as spare material, wrapped in protective plastic, stored off the ground.

ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Set out Vinyl to minimise joints

○ Aluminium reducing strips to exposed edges
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - High traffic areas free of joins
○ Drill plug and screw edge strips
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Floor Protection installed prior to opening access to other trades
ACCEPTANCE CRITERIA - Non-conformances all closed out
○ Submit 3 copies of maintenance manuals, including care and maintenance.
○ Submit 1% of Vinyl used as spare material, wrapped in protective plastic, stored off the ground.
